AVG
{{cpu}}
Used
Buffers
Cached
Free
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Irq - Servicing interrupts
Softirq - Servicing softirqs
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

targets.expr: node_memory_MemTotal{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_MemFree{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Buffers{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Cached{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Slab{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_PageTables{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_SwapCached{instance=~"$node"}
targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by processes
PageTables - Memory dedicated to the lowest page table level
SwapCache - Swap used as cache memory
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use
Cache - Physical RAM used as cache memory
Buffers - Physical RAM used for file buffers
Unused - Free memory unasigned
Swap - Swap memory usage
Committed - The amount of memory presently allocated on the system
Mapped - Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
VmallocUsed - Memory of used virtual address space
Commit Limit - Total amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Unevictable - Unevictable pages can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
